decks.notes: This UR Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells while setting up for a powerful combo finish with Through the Breach and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It also utilizes card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command to maintain control of the game. The deck aims to control the pace of the game, disrupting the opponent's plays and ultimately overpowering them with a massive Eldrazi creature.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly develop a board presence of modular creatures and utilize counters to rapidly increase their power and toughness. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays, taking advantage of synergies between cards like Hardened Scales, The Ozolith, and Animation Module to create a fast and resilient threat on the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes removal and combat tricks to maintain control of the game and ensure victory through efficient and explosive creature-based combat.

The deck focuses on quickly putting out creatures and equipment to create a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Collected Company to efficiently search for and play key cards, while also having disruption and protection elements with cards like Giver of Runes and Ranger-Captain of Eos. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors and lands, while also providing options for additional card draw and lifegain.

The deck focuses on quickly milling through your deck to get key combo pieces into the graveyard, then utilizing recursion effects to bring creatures back onto the battlefield for a explosive finish. It aims to win the game through a combination of graveyard shenanigans, combo plays, and overwhelming the opponent with a large number of creatures hitting the board in a single turn. The key is to carefully manage resources and timing to set up the combo and execute it effectively, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The main strategy of this Modern Aggro - Merfolk deck is to flood the board with Merfolk creatures that can buff each other and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power of your Merfolk, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent. Spreading Seas can disrupt your opponent's mana base while Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to win the game swiftly by overwhelming the opponent with Merfolk synergy.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Death's Shadow to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand and removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats on the board. Additionally, the deck aims to maximize the power of Death's Shadow by reducing its own life total using lands like Bloodstained Mire and disruptive spells, enabling it to become a powerful late-game threat.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses various artifacts like Coretapper, Astral Cornucopia, and Everflowing Chalice to ramp up mana production even further. The deck aims to control the game by using cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponent's strategies, while also generating value from Mystic Forge and Ugin, the Ineffable. Overall, the key concept is to ramp up mana quickly, control the game, and generate value from artifacts.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total to boost the power of Death's Shadow and Scourge of the Skyclaves. Using cards like Street Wraith, Mishra's Bauble, and Thoughtseize to draw cards, disrupt your opponent's strategy, and lower your life total, you aim to control the board with cheap removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember while protecting your threats with Stubborn Denial. With powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Snapcaster Mage, you aim to deal massive damage quickly and overwhelm your opponent before they can stabilize.

The main idea of this Modern Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Kiln Fiend, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. Bedlam Reveler helps refill the hand with card advantage, while cards like Crash Through and Mutagenic Growth provide additional pump and card draw effects. The deck aims to close out games as quickly as possible by efficiently using burn, combat tricks, and card advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage provided by cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. It aims to stall the opponent's game plan while advancing its own win condition, which often involves using Shark Typhoon to create flying threats. The deck also utilizes land destruction with Cleansing Wildfire to disrupt the opponent's mana base and gain an advantage. With a mix of card draw, counterspells, and removal, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana with the UrzaTron lands. The goal is to reach a critical mass of mana to play powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes disruption cards like Chalice of the Void and Ensnaring Bridge to prevent opponents from executing their game plan. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting opponents' strategies, the deck aims to dominate the late game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Burst Lightning can be used to control the board and remove threats, while creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Sprite Dragon can quickly grow in power and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing with Opt, Manamorphose, and Light Up the Stage to keep the aggression going. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive tempo.

The deck focuses on casting powerful spells like Restore Balance and Crashing Footfalls for a massive advantage. By quickly cheating out expensive spells with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Electrodominance, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a flurry of threats. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Ancestral Vision and As Foretold to generate card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of counter magic and removal spells like Force of Negation and Lightning Bolt helps to control the game and disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to create a balanced and explosive combo strategy to dominate the game.

The main concept of this deck is to pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with tax effects like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice, this deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot and unable to execute their strategy effectively. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive elements, this deck aims to control the game and come out on top in the end.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by leveraging powerful cards like Niv-Mizzet Reborn, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Wrenn and Six. The strategy involves using cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate value and gain incremental advantage. The deck also includes a toolbox of versatile spells to deal with a variety of threats, such as removal spells like Lightning Helix and Bring to Light. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's 5-color strategy and ensure the optimal casting of its powerful spells.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan to deal large amounts of damage to the opponent's board or face. Utilizing cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to ramp and fix mana, as well as tools like Skyclave Apparition and Path to Exile for removal and disruption. The deck also includes land destruction with Cleansing Wildfire to disrupt opponent's mana base. The main goal is to efficiently tutor for the combo pieces and control the game until the combo can be assembled for a powerful finish.
